hints.content:
First, let's fill in $\purpleD{6}\blueE{2}\maroonD1$ on the place value chart.

Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-:
$\purpleD{6}$ | $\blueE2$ | $\maroonD1$

$\begin{align}
\purpleD{6}\text{ hundreds} &=\purpleD{600} \\\\
\blueE{2}\text{ tens}&=\blueE{20} \\\\
 \maroonD1\text{ one}&=\maroonD1
\end{align}$

$621=\purpleD{600} + \blueE{20} + \maroonD{1}$

Now, let's say the number $\purpleD6\blueE2\maroonD1$ out loud and write it in written form.

$\purpleD{\text{six hundred}}\blueE{\text{ twenty-}}\maroonD{\text{one}}$

Here is the completed chart:

Number Form | Word Form | Expanded Form
- | - | -
$621$ | Six hundred twenty-one | ${600}+{20} + 1$
